quotes.text: All happy families resemble one another, but each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.text: You cannot depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio,Than are dreamt of in your philosophy.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Work saves us from three great evils boredom, vice and need.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.text: Experience is not what happens to a man; it is what a man does with what happens to him.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.text: What does not kill me makes me stronger.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.text: Dream no small dreams. They have no power to stir the souls of men.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.text: He who controls the past commands the future. He who commands the future conquers the past.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.text: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.text: It is dangerous to be sincere unless you are also stupid.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.text: Humor is the first of the gifts to perish in a foreign tongue.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.text: Perhaps the feelings that we experience when we are in love represent a normal state. Being in love shows a person who he should be.
quotes.author: Anton Chekhov

quotes.text: Of two friends, one is always the slave of the other, although frequently neither acknowledges the fact to himself.
quotes.author: Mikhail Lermontov

quotes.text: It is better to be unhappy and know the worst, than to be happy in a fool's paradise.
quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quotes.text: The formula for prison is a lack of space counterbalanced by a surplus of time.
quotes.author: Joseph Brodsky

quotes.text: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.text: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: Do not ask for whom the bell tolls, it tolls for thee.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.text: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.text: Wise men talk because they have something to say; fools, because they have to say something.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: All human wisdom is contained in these words: Wait and hope!
quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas, pere

quotes.text: At the center of religion is love. I love you and I forgive you. I am like you and you are like me. I love all people. I love the world. I love creating. Everything in our life should be based on love.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.text: A robot may not injure a human being, or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.text: If a man has his eyes bound, you can encourage him as much as you like to stare through the bandage, but he'll never see anything.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: The real nature of the present revealed itself: it was what exists, all that was not present did not exist.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.text: People exaggerate both happiness and unhappiness; we are never so fortunate nor so unfortunate as people say we are.
quotes.author: Honore de Balzac

quotes.text: Curiosity is insubordination in its purest form.
quotes.author: Vladimir Nabokov

quotes.text: A sensible man ought to find sufficient company in himself.
quotes.author: Emily Bronte

quotes.text: The idea of bringing someone into this world fills me with horror. I would curse myself if I were to become a father. May I never transmit to anyone the boredom and the ignominies of existence!
quotes.author: Gustave Flaubert
